node.contents: As far as I understand the problem exists in main thread in org.nkuznetsov.onlineradio.FavoriteList.save(FavoriteList.java:37) method.

astNode.text: As far as I understand the problem exists in main thread in org.nkuznetsov.onlineradio.FavoriteList.save(FavoriteList.java:37) method.

node.contents: In FavoriteList.save() I just concat string from string collection and write ti to shared preferences.

astNode.text: In FavoriteList.save() I just concat string from string collection and write ti to shared preferences.

node.contents: If it's giving you an ANR and it's a method your not waiting to complete do it on another thread:

astNode.text: If it's giving you an ANR and it's a method your not waiting to complete do it on another thread:

node.contents: You'll just have to remember the save may not have completed when you next access the other methods.

astNode.text: You'll just have to remember the save may not have completed when you next access the other methods.

node.contents: If it is a Vector of Strings you don't need to ask for the String value:

astNode.text: If it is a Vector of Strings you don't need to ask for the String value:

node.contents: Also checking if the String is empty is bit more clearer like this:

astNode.text: Also checking if the String is empty is bit more clearer like this:

node.contents: I would also use a StringBuilder instead of concatenation.

astNode.text: I would also use a StringBuilder instead of concatenation.

node.contents: If you go for the threading option be careful, you might want to look at Java Synchonized methods
